de.polygonal.ds.TreeNode<T>

type
class
implements
Collection<T>

A tree structure.

See http://lab.polygonal.de/?p=184

Worst-case running time in Big O notation

Constructor

new(x : T, ?parent : TreeNode<T>)

parameters
x the element to store in this node.
parent if specified, this node is appended to the children of parent.
Creates a TreeNode object storing the element x.

Instance Variables

children : TreeNode<T>

The node's children or null if this node has no children.
This is a doubly linked list of TreeNode objects and children points to the first child.

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

next : TreeNode<T>

The node's next sibling or null if such a sibling does not exist.

parent : TreeNode<T>

The node's parent or null if this node is a root node.

prev : TreeNode<T>

The node's previous sibling or null if such a sibling does not exist.

val : T

The node's data.

Instance Methods

appendNode(x : TreeNode<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x is null (debug only). 1
Unlinks x and appends x as a child to this node.

childIterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new ChildTreeIterator object to iterate over all direct children (excluding this node).
In contrast to iterator(), this method is not recursive

clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, recursively nullifies this subtree.
Removes all child nodes. 1 or n if purge is true

clone(?assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this subtree. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this tree contains the element x. n

depth() : Int

Calculates the depth of this node within this tree.
The depth is defined as the length of the path from the root node to this node.
The root node is at depth 0. n

find(x : T) : TreeNode<T>

returns
the node storing the element x or null if such a node does not exist.
Recursively finds the first occurrence of the node storing the element x in this tree. n

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all nodes, pointers and elements for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional). n

getBuilder() : TreeBuilder<T>

Creates and returns a TreeBuilder object pointing to this node. 1

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError child index out of range (debug only). n
Returns the child at index i or null if the node has no children.

Returns the child index of this node.

Returns the leftmost child of this node or null if this node is a leaf node. 1

inline getFirstSibling() : TreeNode<T>

Returns the leftmost sibling of this node. 1

inline getLastChild() : TreeNode<T>

Returns the rightmost child of this node or null if this node is a leaf node. 1

inline getLastSibling() : TreeNode<T>

Returns the rightmost sibling of this node. 1

inline getRoot() : TreeNode<T>

Returns the root node of this tree. n

inline getSiblingIndex() : Int

Returns the sibling index of this node.
The first sibling equals index 0, the last sibling equals index numChildren() - 1. n

inline hasChildren() : Bool

Returns true if this node has at least one child node. 1

inline hasNextSibling() : Bool

Returns true if this node has a sibling to its right (next != null). 1

inline hasParent() : Bool

Returns true if this node has a parent node. 1

inline hasPrevSibling() : Bool

Returns true if this node has a sibling to its left (prev != null). 1

inline hasSiblings() : Bool

Returns true if this node has at least one sibling. 1

height() : Int

Calculates the height of this tree, assuming this is the root node of this tree.
The height is defined as the length of the path from the root node to the deepest node in the tree.
A tree with one node has a height of one. n

insertAfterChild(child : TreeNode<T>, x : TreeNode<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError child node is not a child of this node (debug only).
Unlinks x and appends x to the specified code>child node. 1

insertBeforeChild(child : TreeNode<T>, x : TreeNode<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError child node is not a child of this node (debug only).
Unlinks x and prepends x to the specified child node. 1

insertChildAt(x : TreeNode<T>, i : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index i out of range (debug only). 1
Unlinks x and inserts x at the index position i.

isAncestor(x : TreeNode<T>) : Bool

Returns true if this node is an ancestor of x.

inline isChild() : Bool

Returns true is this node is a child node of this tree.
A child node has a parent node. 1

isDescendant(x : TreeNode<T>) : Bool

Returns true if this node is an descendant of x.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this tree is empty. 1

inline isLeaf() : Bool

Returns true if this node is a leaf node of this tree.
A leaf node has no children. 1

inline isRoot() : Bool

Returns true if this node is the root node of this tree.
A root node has no parent node. 1

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new TreeIterator object to iterate over all elements contained in the nodes of this subtree (including this node).
The elements are visited by using a preorder traversal.

levelorder(?process : TreeNode<T> -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
process a function that is invoked on every traversed node.
The first argument holds a reference to the current node, while the second argument stores custom data specified by the userData parameter (default is null). Once process returns false, the traversal stops immediately and no further nodes are examined.
If omitted, element.visit() is used instead.
In this case all elements have to implement Visitable.
userData custom data that is passed to every visited node via process or element.visit(). If omitted, null is used.
Performs a queue-based, iterative level-order traversal.
In a level-order traversal all nodes of a tree are processed by depth: first the root, then the children of the root, etc.

inline numChildren() : Int

The total number of child nodes (non-recursive). 1

inline numNextSiblings() : Int

Counts the total number of succeeding siblings (excluding this). n

inline numPrevSiblings() : Int

Counts the total number of preceding siblings (excluding this). n

inline numSiblings() : Int

Counts the total number of siblings (excluding this). n

postorder(?process : TreeNode<T> -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?iterative : Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
process a function that is invoked on every traversed node.
The first argument holds a reference to the current node, while the second argument stores custom data specified by the userData parameter (default is null). Once process returns false, the traversal stops immediately and no further nodes are examined.
If omitted, element.visit() is used instead.
In this case all elements have to implement Visitable.
iterative if true, an iterative traversal is used (default traversal style is recursive).
userData custom data that is passed to every visited node via process or element.visit(). If omitted, null is used.
Performs a recursive postorder traversal.
A preorder traversal performs the following steps:
  • Traverse the left subtree of the node.
  • Traverse the right subtree of the node.
  • Visit the node.

preorder(?process : TreeNode<T> -> Bool -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?preflight : Bool, ?iterative : Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
process a function that is invoked on every traversed node.
The first argument holds a reference to the current node, the second arguments stores the preflight flag and the third argument stores custom data specified by the userData parameter (default is null). Once process returns false, the traversal stops immediately and no further nodes are examined.
If omitted, element.visit() is used instead.
preflight if true, an extra traversal is performed before the actual traversal runs. The first pass visits all elements and calls element.visit() with the preflight parameter set to true. In this pass the return value determines whether the element (and all its children) will be processed (true) or excluded (false) from the final traversal, which is the second pass (preflight parameter set to false).
The same applies when using a process function.
In this case all elements have to implement Visitable.
iterative if true, an iterative traversal is used (default traversal style is recursive).
userData custom data that is passed to every visited node via process or element.visit(). If omitted, null is used.
Performs a recursive preorder traversal.
A preorder traversal performs the following steps:
  • Visit the node.
  • Traverse the left subtree of the node.
  • Traverse the right subtree of the node.

prependNode(x : TreeNode<T>) : Void

Unlinks x and prepends x as a child of this node. 1

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if at least one occurrence of x was removed.
Runs a recursive preorder traversal that removes all nodes storing the element x.
Tree nodes are not rearranged, so if a node stores x, the complete subtree rooted at that node is unlinked. n

removeChildAt(i : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index i is out of range (debug only). n
Removes the child at index i.

removeChildren(?i : Int, ?n : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i or n out of range (debug only). n
Removes n children starting at the specified index i in the range [i, i + n].
If n is -1, n is set to numChildren() - i.

serialize(?node : TreeNode<T>, ?list : Array<{ v : T, c : Bool}>) : Array<{ v : T, c : Bool}>

parameters
node the root of the tree.
returns
a flattened tree.
see
An interesting tree serialization algorithm from DWARF
Serializes this tree. The tree can be rebuild by calling unserialize().

setChildIndex(x : TreeNode<T>, i : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index i is out of range (debug only). n
Changes the index of the child x to i.

setFirst() : Void

Successively swaps this node with previous siblings until it reached the head of the sibling list. 1

setLast() : Void

Successively swaps this node with next siblings until it reached the tail of the sibling list. 1

setStack(stack : Array<TreeNode<T>>) : Void

Assigns a reuses a stack for iterative preorder, postorder and levelorder traversals.
1

size() : Int

The total number of nodes in the tree rooted at this node. n

sort(compare : T -> T -> Int, ?useInsertionSort : Bool) : Void

parameters
compare a comparison function.
If null, the elements are compared using element.compare().
In this case all elements have to implement Comparable.
useInsertionSort if true, the dense array is sorted using the insertion sort algorithm. This is faster for nearly sorted lists.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element does not implement Comparable (debug only).
Sorts the children of this node using the merge sort algorithm. n log n for merge sort and n² for insertion sort

swapChildren(a : TreeNode<T>, b : TreeNode<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError a and b are not siblings (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError a equals b (debug only). 1
Swaps the child a with child b by swapping their values.

swapChildrenAt(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index i out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index j out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i equals j (debug only). 1
Swaps the child at index i with the child at index j by swapping their values.

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an array containing all elements in the tree rooted at this node.
The elements are collected using a preorder traversal.

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns a dense array containing all elements in the tree rooted at this node.
The elements are collected using a preorder traversal.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Example:
	  var root = new de.polygonal.ds.TreeNode<Int>(0); //create the root of the tree
	  var builder = new de.polygonal.ds.TreeBuilder<Int>(root);
	  builder.appendChild(1);
	  builder.down();
	  builder.appendChild(2);
	  builder.up();
	  builder.appendChild(3);
	  trace(root);
	  {TreeNode (root), children: 2, depth:0, value: 0}
	  +---{TreeNode (child), children: 1, depth:1, value: 1}
	  |   +---{TreeNode (leaf+child), depth:2, value: 2}
	  +---{TreeNode (leaf+child), depth:1, value: 3}

toVector() : flash.Vector<Dynamic>

Returns a Vector.<T> object containing all elements in the tree rooted at this node.
The elements are collected using a preorder traversal.

inline unlink() : TreeNode<T>

returns
a subtree rooted at this node.
Unlinks this node.
1

unserialize(list : Array<{ v : T, c : Bool}>) : TreeNode<T>

parameters
list the flattened tree
returns
the root of the tree.
Unserializes a given list into a TreeNode structure.
First create a dummy node which will be the root of the unserialized tree, then call unserialize(). Example:
	  var root = new de.polygonal.ds.TreeNode<String>(null);
	  root.unserialize(mySerializedTree);
